intro: Boehmeria spicata var. akari, commonly known as the Japanese nettle or akari hemp, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettle. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with serrated edges. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are wind-pollinated. This variant is often cultivated for its fibrous stalks, which are used in traditional papermaking and textile production.
